components.name: Frontend (React)
components.description: The frontend is built using React, responsible for user interface, data input forms, and displaying threat model results. It interacts with the backend API.

components.name: Backend API (Node.js)
components.description: The backend API is implemented using Node.js, handling incoming requests from the frontend, processing threat models, and interacting with the database.

components.name: Database (PostgreSQL)
components.description: PostgreSQL is used to store threat model data, including user information, threat model definitions, and results.

components.name: Authentication Service
components.description: Handles user authentication and authorization, ensuring only authorized users can access the application and its data.

data_flows.description: User submits a threat model request via the frontend, which is transmitted to the backend API.
The backend API retrieves and stores threat model data in the database.
The backend API sends the processed threat model results back to the frontend for display.

trust_boundaries.name: User Input Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: The boundary between user input and the backend. This is a critical area for vulnerability exploitation.

trust_boundaries.name: Database Boundary
trust_boundaries.description: Controls access to the database, preventing unauthorized data access and modification.
